items.title: Wall Street slips with mixed data and earnings ahead of Fed week | REUTERS
items.author: Reuters
items.content:
<article>Wall Street's main indexes closed lower as investors stepped back while they digested a mixed bag of economic data and earnings reports and prepared for a week filled with economic releases and a Federal Reserve meeting.

#News #usstocks #wallstreet #earnings #federalreserve #trump #investors #markets #Reuters #Newsfeed

items.title: This Ukrainian unit launches drone attacks deep into Russia | REUTERS
items.author: Reuters
items.content:
<article>Ukraine is using unmanned aircraft carrying explosive warheads as part of a campaign of long-range drone attacks, aiming to inflict blows on Russia far behind the front line. Kyiv's military granted @Reuters exclusive access during the launch of the drones.
  
#News #Reuters #Newsfeed #ukraine #russia #droneattacks

items.title: NYC bill calls for paid sick leave to care for pets | REUTERS
items.author: Reuters
items.content:
<article>New Yorkers might soon use paid sick leave to care for ailing pets. A proposed bill would amend a NYC law, allowing workers to use their paid sick leave to tend to themselves, family members, or their furry friends.

items.title: US agents raid New Jersey worksite as immigration crackdown begins | REUTERS
items.author: Reuters
items.content:
<article>US immigration agents rounded up undocumented migrants as well as American citizens, including a military veteran, in a raid on a Newark, New Jersey, worksite, which the city's mayor said violated the people's rights.

items.author: Reuters
items.content:

items.title: LIVE: Newark Mayor Baraka discusses ICE raids in New Jersey
items.author: Reuters
items.content:
<article>New Jersey's Newark Mayor Ras Baraka, elected officials and community organizations hold a news conference a day after U.S. immigration agents rounded up undocumented migrants as well as American citizens in a raid of a Newark worksite that the mayor said involved detaining a military veteran and violations of the people's rights.

items.author: Reuters
items.content:

The performance in the Swiss ski-resort town Davos was part of the ‚ÄòPerforming Hope‚Äô climate change initiative from Arctic Basecamp.  Executive director Gail Whiteman explains what they are hoping to achieve.
